JUDGES: Lech Garlicki;Nebojša Vučinić;Nicolas Bratza;Sverre Erik Jebens;Vincent A. De Gaetano;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants , Mr PERSON , PERSON and PERSON , are NORP nationals who live in GPE PERSON . They were represented before the ORG by Mr J. Janas , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Mr J. PERSON of ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . NORP On DATE Tsar PERSON , then ORG , had issued a decree ( ukaz ) granting the inhabitants of the Rosochaty Róg village a profit à prendre which amounted to a right to fish from shore in the Wigry and GPE . The right was approved on DATE by ORG and entered in the NORP land register in DATE . The right to fish was enjoyed only by those peasants who had the right entered in their so - called “ liquidation tables ” , and after their death by their legal heirs .
CARDINAL . In DATE GPE regained independence .

CARDINAL . On DATE LAW was adopted ( ustawa wodna ) which introduced a general rule that all waters were public unless they constituted private property pursuant to the LAW or pursuant to special legal titles . Subsequently , further numerous legal acts were adopted aimed at nationalisation of waters .
CARDINAL . The applicants are owners of land adjacent to LOC .

CARDINAL . In DATE they filed a statement of claim with ORG ( PERSON ) against ORG in which they referred to the Tsar ’s decree of DATE , granting the inhabitants of the Rosochaty Róg village a profit à prendre which amounted to a right to fish in LOC . They stressed that the owners of the land adjacent to the lake had benefited from the right to fish in the lake until DATE , when the director of ORG had prohibited the applicants from fishing there .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG delivered a judgment in which it found that since DATE the applicants had had a right to fish in the lake , which had not been revoked by any of the subsequent legal regulations . The court specified that the right was limited to the right to fish from the shore , without using boats or platforms . In addition , the fishermen had to respect the fish - protection periods .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( Sąd Apelacyjny ) upheld the firstinstance judgment . The judgment is final .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicants filed another statement of claim against ORG in which they asked the court to declare that their fishing rights comprised also the right to fish from a platform and while standing in the water .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG gave judgment . It confirmed that the applicants had a right to fish for their own needs in LOC and that they could exercise that right from their land , from a platform or while standing in the water .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld that decision .

CARDINAL . On the defendant ’s appeal , on DATE ORG ( PERSON ) quashed both judgments and dismissed the claim . It held that since DATE at DATE when the new FAC had come into force - the applicants’ right to fish in LOC had expired . The court stressed that by virtue of sections CARDINAL and CARDINAL of that Act all waters in GPE had been nationalised . It further considered that nationalisation constituted a primary method of acquiring property so that ownership of the waters had been transferred to the ORG without any servitudes .
CARDINAL . ORG , inter alia , found :
“ The lower courts omitted the consequences for the existence of the claimants’ fishing rights which follow from sections CARDINAL and CARDINAL of LAW .

In accordance with the unanimous opinion of the legal doctrine and of the jurisprudence this LAW led to nationalisation of waters . ( ... ) In line with the generally accepted approach the nationalisation constitutes a primary method of acquiring property which signifies that the title to property is transferred to the ORG free from any servitudes , unless the nationalisation act provides for an exception in this respect . ( ... )

Thus , it can be reasonably argued that private waters were nationalised free from any servitudes . Although , generally speaking , in the present case the right to fish encumbered the ORG object from the outset , nevertheless the primary goal of the nationalisation of waters ( rationalisation of their use ) argues in favour of the view that this nationalisation , a fortiori , led to the expiry of the property rights ( prawa rzeczowe ) encumbering ORG waters . Thus , even if the fishing rights had not expired earlier , they did so on the date of the entry into force of LAW . ”

CARDINAL . The applicants subsequently filed a constitutional complaint . On DATE the Constitutional Court refused to examine it . The applicants appealed . On DATE ORG allowed their appeal and decided to consider their case .
CARDINAL . The applicants subsequently filed a request with ORG , for the reopening of the proceedings that had been terminated on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE , upon a question of law referred by the Ombudsman relating to fishing rights in other lakes , ORG adopted a resolution ( III CZP CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) and stressed that the fishing rights had been unenforceable since DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the ORG request for reopening .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued a decision in which it discontinued the proceedings in the applicants’ case on formal grounds . It held that the constitutional complaint had not concerned an alleged unconstitutionality of a legal provision but rather a flawed application by ORG to the facts of the case . One of the judges in his dissenting opinion considered that even assuming that the applicants’ right to fish in LOC was a property right , it had been limited by LAW of DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE LAW was adopted ( ustawa o rybołóstwie ) . The LAW stipulated that the right to fish was linked to the ownership of the waters in question . In public waters the right belonged to the ORG .

CARDINAL . By DATE CARDINAL of LAW ( prawo wodne ) all waters in GPE were nationalised . The LAW is no longer in force . Currently , the legal status of inland waters is regulated by LAW of DATE which entered into force on DATE .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) paragraph CARDINAL of LAW ( ustawa o ochronie przyrody ) of DATE , as worded at the material time , provided that fishing was prohibited in natural parks , with the exception of areas specifically designated in the conservation plans . The LAW was amended and this provision repealed on DATE . LAW ( CARDINAL ) paragraphCARDINAL now provides :
“ Catching fish and other water - borne living organisms with the exception of areas specifically designated in the conservation plans [ is prohibited ] ” .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG referred to ORG a question of law ( pytanie prawne ) as to whether the fishing rights granted in DATE ( to fish in certain PERSON lakes ) had expired in DATE with the adoption of the new LAW . The Ombudsman referred to the divergent practice of the domestic courts and ORG in examining such claims .

CARDINAL . In its resolution of DATE ( III CZP CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) , adopted by a bench of CARDINAL judges , ORG dealt with this question . The court referred to LAW and concluded that the fishing rights granted in DATE had not expired in DATE . However , they had been unenforceable since the entry into force of LAW .
